column4: and pretty much everything that can be done in shell can be done in batch files.
the difference is that linux lets you do anything that can be done on the system from a shell, which ISN'T possible in windows.

but it's a pain in the ass to set ;)  plus, in Ubuntu, we can just type "firefox blahblah" from a term and it runs... or "<insertanyapp>" where on windows you cannot unless it's in your path, and nothing is every in your path that's worth $.02
